result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaleb M Scherrer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess GHB,GB,BDO, Ketamine, Flunitraz., a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(f).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 0 Days.
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration AND the Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Racine County Case #14CF1198.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 12-01-2015.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Within First 120 days Obtain a valid driver's license.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  60 Days Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion.
Each year of Probation with the 20 hours in the Last Year to be completed by 04-30-2018.
